results.title: Magnus and the beansteak
results.creator_credit: Harris Watts, John Fairley and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Scientists”.
The views of food technologist, Magnus Pyke on the production of synthetic foods derived from soya beans and chemicals, that could prevent heart disease and help to feed some of the world’s undernourished population.

results.title: Magnum photos: the changing of a myth [Widescreen]
results.brief_description: Magnum Photos was founded in New York in 1947 and established as a centre for photo-journalism where the photographer owned the copyright and was allowed the freedom and integrity to produce their own work. Its ideals were high, just like the four photographers who created Magnum Photos - George Rodger, David Seymour (aka Chim), Henri Cartier-Bresson and Robert Capa and the intention of this co-operative was to create an ongoing pool of 50 professional photographers who, with shared beliefs about their photography, could go and cover every conceivable aspect of the human condition across the globe. In this documentary, German filmmaker Reiner Holzemer introduces some of the internationally recognised photographers currently with Magnum Photos and joins them in their field work in various parts of the world, including England with Martin Parr, Canada with Larry Towell, and Northern Ireland with Donovan Wylie. Also includes interviews with Philip Jones Griffiths, Eve Arnold, Marc Riboud, Burt Glinn, Rene Burri, Luc Delahay among others and provides an illuminating insight into the workings of Magnum Photos, considered one of today’s most prestigious photo agencies. Contains many great photo-images, some that are instantly recognisable, and provides an interesting and informative program on the topic of photography and photo-journalism. Commentary by Mike Lucas.

results.title: Magnum force
results.creator_credit: Ted Post, Robert Daley and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: The second “Dirty Harry” movie, “Magnum Force” concerns itself with a vigilante group that has targeted notorious criminals whose power and influence have made them immune from prosecution. When a prominent gang boss is set free by the air-headed liberal courts, he is soon exterminated by an avenging motorcycle cop. While Detective Harry Callahan is no great friend of civil liberties, he is dead set against wholesale murder as a solution to legal loopholes. Discovering that all the killings have been committed by a .357 Magnum, Callahan suspects his on-the-edge ex-partner is responsible. But the conspiracy is less transparent than that, as Harry learns, almost at the cost of his own life. Co-scripted by John Milius and Michael Cimino. Cast includes Clint Eastwood, Hal Holbrook, Mitchell Ryan, Felton Perry and David Soul.

results.title: Magnolia [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Paul Thomas Anderson, Joanne Sellar and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: Paul Thomas Anderson’s third feature - “Magnolia” - is an exploration of the coincidence of life, built around a dozen major characters in California’s San Fernando Valley. Their lives interlace and interlock over just twenty-four hours, but in that time they offer us a wealth of insights into the contemporary quests for love, knowledge, respect and money, culminating in a well-known and absurdly ingenious climax. The cast includes Philip Seymour Hoffman, Julianne Moore, Tom Cruise, Philip Baker Hall, John C. Reilly, Jason Robards, William H. Macy and Melora Walters, each of whom arguably delivers the performance of their careers. Also features a soundtrack by Aimee Mann, whose songs were the inspiration for the film.

results.title: Magnolia
results.brief_description: Paul Thomas Anderson’s epic mosaic of interrelated characters search for happiness, forgiveness and meaning in the San Fernando Valley. Featuring a star-studded cast including Tom Cruise, Philip Seymour Hoffman, Julianne Moore and William H Macy.

constellations_other.name: Using the silent film aesthetic
constellations_other.description: Explore how contemporary filmmakers use visual references to the silent era to convey information to a film literate audience.

results.description: An epic mosaic of many interrelated characters in search of happiness, forgiveness, and meaning in the San Fernando Valley.
description_for_label: An epic mosaic of many interrelated characters in search of happiness, forgiveness, and meaning in the San Fernando Valley.

results.title: Magnificent obsession [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Douglas Sirk, Ross Hunter and Universal International Pictures
results.brief_description: Through exaggerated coincidence and accompanying catastrophe, the mark of melodrama, a playboy becomes a surgeon and secret devotee of a form of Christianity as he seeks to atone for the death of a philanthropic doctor and the subsequent blindness of the doctor’s wife, indirect results of events for which he is responsible. Sirk does not parody this implausible material but mines it for irony by bringing out the irrational aspect - the obsession with vision on different levels. Irony here results from a playing on oppositions, even contradictions, just beneath the surface (e.g. one dies so another can live). This heightening (a kind of ‘madness’) is achieved through mise en scene: a sense of cultural decadence (the glossy surfaces of middle America) is played off against emotionalism, innocent energy deflected by the emergence of conscience. Originally filmed in Technicolor with lavish cinematography by Russell Metty. Based on the novel by Lloyd C. Douglas. Cast includes Jane Wyman, Rock Hudson, Barbara Rush, Agnes Moorehead and Otto Kruger.

results.title: Magnificent memory
results.creator_credit: R Bacha, Film Group of India and R R D Productions
results.brief_description: The Mogul buildings in Delhi and the Kathak dance of Northern India. The first part of the film studies the architecture of the palaces and forts built by Shah Jehan, the Hall of Audience, the Pearl Mosque and the Red Fort nearby; the second part shows the Kathak dance in this setting.

results.title: Magnets for beginners
results.brief_description: Shows what materials magnets attract, what a magnetic field is, what poles are, and how magnetic force can pass through objects. Uses iron filings suspended in glycerine to show magnetic fields in three dimensions.
results.description: Shows what materials magnets attract, what a magnetic field is, what poles are, and how magnetic force can pass through objects. Uses iron filings suspended in glycerine to show magnetic fields in three dimensions.

results.title: Magnets
results.brief_description: The film demonstrates a few basic facts about bar magnets and their behaviour. Their father explains to Bob and Betty the difference between temporary and permanent magnets. The two children then learn that: like poles repel and unlike poles attract each other; that a suspended bar magnet acts like a compass needle; and that the magnetic force of a magnet will go through paper and glass.

results.title: Magnetism
results.creator_credit: Paul Vincent, Dennis Tupicoff and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: An animation that bleakly looks at love. When a couple meet and lay eyes on each other in a bar it’s instant attraction. Locked into an endless embrace (and locked in chains) with magnets abounding to symbolise the courtship, the relationship dramatically ends. The magnets are seen to disappear and join a graveyard of other magnets, a graveyard of lost love.
